intro: Platycoryne trilobata, commonly known as the three-lobed flat-leaf plant, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves with three distinct lobes. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported medicinal properties. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests.
